      • ASSET_INPUT_DATA_PRESERVATION_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String ASSET_INPUT_DATA_PRESERVATION_ENABLED
        A flag to preserve data in the input dependencies of each asset (true by default). This can be set to false to reduce storage consumption and processing cost for the data, but in such a case, the corresponding configuration of Ledger has to be set to the same value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEDGER_HOST

        public static final java.lang.String LEDGER_HOST
        Optional. A hostname or an IP address of the server ("localhost" by default). It assuems that there is a single endpoint that is given by DNS or a load balancer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEDGER_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String LEDGER_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the server (50051 by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEDGER_PRIVILEGED_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String LEDGER_PRIVILEGED_PORT
        Optional. A port number of the server for privileged services (50052 by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEDGER_CERT_HOLDER_ID

        public static final java.lang.String LEDGER_CERT_HOLDER_ID
        Required. The holder ID of the certificate of Ledger ("ledger" by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEDGER_CERT_VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String LEDGER_CERT_VERSION
        Optional. The version of the certificate (1 by default). Use another bigger integer if you need to change your private key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_HOLDER_ID

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_HOLDER_ID
        Required. The holder ID of a certificate ("auditor" by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CERT_VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String CERT_VERSION
        Optional. The version of the certificate (1 by default). Use another bigger integer if you need to change your private key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_KEY_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_PATH
        Required. The path of the certificate file in PEM format.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_KEY_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_PEM
        Required if private_key_path is empty. PEM-encoded private key data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_ENABLED
        Optional. A flag to enable TLS communication (false by default).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PATH
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (file path) for TLS communication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM

        public static final java.lang.String TLS_CA_ROOT_CERT_PEM
        Optional. A custom CA root certificate (PEM data) for TLS communication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL

        public static final java.lang.String AUTHORIZATION_CREDENTIAL
        Optional. An authorization credential. (e.g. authorization: Bearer token) If this is given, clients will add "authorization: [credential]" http/2 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
